contents.text: Eli and the Red Hat Blown by the Wind
Eli and Mom Elephants go for a walk down at the grassland.  It is a windy day.

Wooooosh!

A strong wind blows Miss Antelope's red hat right off her head!

"Help me catch my hat. My red hat," she cries.

"Eli, let's help Miss Antelope catch her red hat," says Mama Elephant.

But Eli is scared. "If I run too fast, I will trip and fall over," says Eli.

"You'll be fine! Come on. We will start slow and get faster one step at a time," says Mama.
So the two elephants run up and down the grassland after the flying red hat blown by the wind. A strong wind.

The two elephants are sweating and breathing a little faster. 

"Hee hee hee! This is fun, Mom," says Eli.
Tell me about a time when you were active with your Mom, Dad, or other adult who lives with you at home.
contents.subtext: "Active" means any activity that makes you sweat or become out of breath like running, playing in the park, dancing, or swimming.

contents.text: What did you enjoy when you were active with your Mom/Dad/Caregiver?

Thinking about the fun things that 
happen during 
physical activity can make it more enjoyable!
Chapter 2

The hat flies and flies, then lands on a tree. 

But it is not just any tree...

It's a baobab tree. A big, tall tree.

"That's a very tall tree," says Eli.

"How do we get Miss Antelope's red hat?"

"I have an idea," says Mom.

"Point your trunk towards the hat," says Mama.

Eli and Mama point their big trunks at the red hat on the big tall tree.

"Now one, two, three, blow that hat," yells Mom.

They blow the hat at the same time.

"Hey Mom, this is fun! I can blow the red hat on the big tall tree!" says Eli.

"That’s because you exercise often. It makes you strong and healthy. And you will feel good about yourself” says Mama.

"Come on, let’s blow that red hat one more time."
Tell me a time when you were active with your family. What are the good feelings that you had after exercising?
contents.subtext: Active means any activity that makes you sweat or become out of breath like running, playing in the park, dancing, and swimming.

contents.text: What are the good feelings that you had after exercising?
Being active regularly can help you think better at school and work. It can make you feel great too!
As the elephants blow towards the hat once again, the hat flies off the big tall tree and up into the air.
The wind catches the hat yet again, it flies further and further away!
Chapter 3
Do you want to know what's going to happen next?
contents.subtext: To read the rest of the story, complete a one-week challenge with your family.

contents.text:
You have completed this storybook. Your next story is:

"Cobby and the Game of Cowabuball"
